comment.text: This translation key is used to display a title when uploading a file from a portal or document space. The placeholder {productName} will be replaced with the actual product name. This text appears as part of an upload option in the UI.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Lataa {{productName}}:sta' literally translates to "Download from {{productName}}". While understandable, it's not the most natural phrasing in Finnish. A more natural and idiomatic translation would be 'Lataa {{productName}} -sta' or 'Lataa {{productName}}' depending on the context.

The translation "Վերբեռնում {{productName}}-ից" literally translates to "Upload from {{productName}}". While technically correct, it's not the most natural way to say "Upload from [product name]" in Armenian. A more idiomatic translation would imply a source or origin.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Վերբեռնում {{productName}}-ի (Verbternum {{productName}}-i) which translates to 'Upload from {{productName}}' and implies uploading 'of' or 'from' a source.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "{{productName}} වෙතින් උඩුගත කරන්න" is a literal translation and might sound unnatural in Sinhala. A more natural phrasing would be something like "{{productName}} ඔස්සේ උඩුගත කරන්න" or "{{productName}} හරහා උඩුගත කරන්න".  The word 'vevin' is more often used to indicate 'from' in a source or origin sense, while 'ossee' or 'harahaa' are more suitable for indicating a medium or channel.
The Serbian translation "Отпреми из {{productName}}" does not accurately convey the meaning of "Upload from {{productName}}". "Отпреми" means "ship" or "dispatch", not "upload".

While 'Otpremi' is a valid verb, 'Upload' in this context implies a more direct transfer of files. 'Otpremi' has a connotation of shipping or sending something externally, not necessarily uploading to a system.

The translation 'Передати з {{productName}}' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Upload from {{productName}}'. 'Передати' implies handing over or transferring, which doesn't directly convey the action of uploading. A more appropriate translation would convey the idea of uploading data or files.
